question: 手伝う
sourceMnemonic: When you <kanji>transmit</kanji> your <kanji>hand</kanji> to something or someone, you're putting out your hand <vocabulary>to help</vocabulary> them or <vocabulary>to assist</vocabulary> them.
sourceReadingMnemonic: Both of these are the kun'yomi readings that you've already learned! The thing is, the <ja>た</ja> from <ja>伝</ja>'s <ja>つた</ja> changes into <ja>だ</ja> for who knows what reason. Perhaps you can ask for someone <vocabulary>to help</vocabulary> you to understand this dumb reading change.
